THIS is offered as a thoroughly satisfactory manual for preparatory schools and colleges, and it is believed to combine excellences of di- verse kinds in such a way as to be the closest possible approach to an ideal grammar.

Fir-st. This has always been regarded as the truest and soundest of Latin grammar manuals. Instead of making arbitrary laws and distinc- tions in order to secure an artificial clearness of statement, this gram- mar has been faithful to the spirit and the facts of the language. This is its fundamental excellence. The grammar explains the language instead of trying to make the language bear out the grammar.
